sections.heading: Purpose of this flow
body: The Create Plant Wizard is a guided, 9-step process used to add a new plant instance to your account.

It helps you (optionally) link the plant to a Plant Definition from the Flovers database, capture context such as location and exposure, and optionally generate reminders based on the plant’s preferences.
This wizard is used only for creating a new plant. Editing an existing plant is done in a separate flow.

sections.heading: Step 01 — Choose a plant definition (optional)
body: You can search Plant Definitions (built-in species profiles) using the search field.
Below the search input you’ll find a list of popular indoor plants as a quick shortcut.
Optionally, you can use Plant Recognition: tap the scan button, take or select a photo, and the system will return the 3 best matches.
If you accept a recognition suggestion, the selected Plant Definition is applied to the new plant instance.

sections.heading: Step 02 — Review definition details
body: If you selected a Plant Definition, this step displays the definition details including the image and core traits/preferences.
This is a review step so you can confirm the chosen species profile before continuing.

sections.heading: Step 03 — Select a location (required)
body: Choose the Location where the plant is kept (e.g., Kitchen, Living room, Balcony).
You can also add a new Location directly from this step.
At the moment, selecting a Location is mandatory to proceed.

sections.heading: Step 04 — Exposure (optional measurements)
body: This step helps you capture the plant’s exposure context: direction, light level, and distance from the window.
Direction can be measured using the phone compass if compass permissions are granted.
Light level can be measured if the required permissions are granted and the device supports a light sensor.
All exposure values are optional—you can enter them manually or skip them.

sections.heading: Step 05 — Container and soil (optional)
body: Define what container the plant is in (e.g., plastic, ceramic) and what soil/substrate you use.
These fields are optional, but can improve the accuracy of suggested care intervals when automatic tasks are enabled.

sections.heading: Step 06 — Automatic tasks (optional, when using a Plant Definition)
body: If your plant is linked to a Plant Definition, Flovers can generate reminders/tasks automatically based on the definition’s care preferences.
Enable the main checkbox to allow automatic task generation, then choose which task types should be created (e.g., watering, misting, fertilising, repotting, care).
Suggested intervals are based on the selected Plant Definition and may be adjusted using values from Exposure and Container/Soil when available.
You can skip this step entirely if you prefer to create reminders manually later.

sections.heading: Step 07 — Add your own photo (optional)
body: You can add a custom photo of your plant from your phone.
This step is optional and can be done later via plant editing tools, depending on your app flow.

sections.heading: Step 08 — Final details (required name)
body: Set the plant display name (mandatory).
Optionally add notes and the purchase date.
These details are shown in Plant Details and help you keep a meaningful history for each plant.

sections.heading: Step 09 — Summary and confirmation
body: After successful creation, the wizard shows a confirmation/summary screen.
From here you can proceed to your plant list or open the newly created plant, depending on the navigation flow in your app.

sections.heading: Notes and permissions
body: Plant Recognition requires access to the camera and/or media library, depending on how you provide a photo.
Exposure measurements may require permission to use device sensors (e.g., compass) and depend on hardware availability.
Linking to a Plant Definition is optional—if you skip it, you can still create a plant and define reminders manually.
